conclusion: Analyze the graph to determine the relationship between velocity squared and displacement for both cars.

The image shows a graph with velocity squared (vÂ²) on the vertical axis and displacement (x) on the horizontal axis. Two lines, labeled A and B, represent the motion of two cars. Line A is steeper than line B.
The graph represents the relationship between the square of the velocity and the displacement for two cars, A and B. The slope of the line on the graph indicates the acceleration of the car.
Identify the Slope: The slope of line A is greater than the slope of line B.
Compare Accelerations: Since the slope of line A is steeper, the acceleration of car A is higher than that of car B.
Conclusion: Based on the graph, car A has a greater acceleration than car B.
Car A has the greater acceleration.
